# Introduction to Climate Change

Welcome to **Climate Change** - understanding global warming!

## What You Will Learn:
- **Greenhouse Effect** - How Earth stays warm
- **Evidence** - Proof of change
- **Impacts** - Effects on world
- **Solutions** - Mitigation and adaptation

> **Fun Fact:** CO2 levels are higher now than any time in 800,000 years!

slides.title: Greenhouse Effect
slides.content:
# Greenhouse Effect

## How It Works:
1. Sun's energy reaches Earth
2. Earth absorbs and re-radiates as infrared
3. Greenhouse gases trap heat
4. Planet stays warm

## Greenhouse Gases:

| Gas | Source | GWP |
|-----|--------|-----|
| CO2 | Fossil fuels | 1 |
| CH4 | Agriculture, gas | 28 |
| N2O | Fertilizers | 265 |
| CFCs | Refrigerants | 1000s |

GWP = Global Warming Potential (vs CO2)

## Enhanced Effect:
- Human emissions increase gases
- More heat trapped
- Temperature rises

slides.title: Evidence
slides.content:
# Evidence for Climate Change

## Observed Changes:

| Indicator | Trend |
|-----------|-------|
| Temperature | +1.1 C since 1850 |
| Sea level | +20 cm since 1900 |
| Arctic ice | Declining |
| Glaciers | Retreating |

## Sources of Evidence:
- Thermometer records
- Ice cores (800,000 years)
- Tree rings
- Coral records
- Satellite data

## Scientific Consensus:
- 97%+ of climate scientists agree
- Human activities are primary cause
- IPCC reports

slides.title: Impacts
slides.content:
# Climate Change Impacts

## Physical:
- Rising temperatures
- Sea level rise
- Extreme weather
- Changing precipitation

## Biological:
- Shifting species ranges
- Earlier spring events
- Coral bleaching
- Extinctions

## Human:
- Food security threats
- Water scarcity
- Health impacts
- Climate refugees

## Regional:
- Arctic: fastest warming
- Islands: flooding
- Africa: drought
- Australia: fires

slides.title: Solutions
slides.content:
# Climate Solutions

## Mitigation:
Reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

| Strategy | Approach |
|----------|----------|
| Energy | Renewables, efficiency |
| Transport | EVs, public transit |
| Buildings | Insulation, heat pumps |
| Land use | Forests, agriculture |

## Adaptation:
Live with changes.

- Sea walls, flood defenses
- Drought-resistant crops
- Early warning systems

## Policy:
- Paris Agreement
- Carbon pricing
- Net-zero targets

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Climate Change Summary

## Science:
- Greenhouse effect keeps Earth warm
- Human emissions enhance it
- ~1.1 C warming so far

## Evidence:
- Temperature records
- Ice cores, satellites
- 97% scientific consensus

## Impacts:
- Weather, sea level, ecosystems

## Solutions:
| Type | Goal |
|------|------|
| Mitigation | Reduce emissions |
| Adaptation | Live with changes |

> **Congratulations!** You've completed Climate Change!
